name: Total Charitable Giving
description: Charitable giving can occur through many different avenues for generosity. Here, we use one measure of aggregate charitable giving, which includes contributions from individuals, corporations, bequests, and foundations.

measures.name: Total charitable contributions
measures.notes: Estimates rely on econometrics methods developed by Indiana University Lilly Family School of Philanthropyand tabulations of tax data, economic indicators, and demographics.

name: Donor-Advised Funds
description: Donor-advised funds (DAFs) are giving accounts established at public charities that allow donors to make a charitable contribution, receive an immediatetax deduction, and recommend grants over time.The public charity maintains legal control over the contributions and works with the donor who can advise on funding recommendations

measures.name: Total value of contributions made to donor-advised funds
measures.notes: Estimates are drawn from a longitudinal study of a representative sample from 976 charitable sponsors that reported DAF assets in any year

measures.name: Total number of DAFs in the US
measures.notes: Estimates are drawn from a longitudinal study of a representative sample from 976 charitable sponsors that reported DAF assetsin any year.

measures.notes: Estimates are calculated using data from about 154,430 giving accounts in Fidelity Charitableâ€™s internal reporting database.

measures.name: Total dollars contributed to DAFs at community foundations
measures.notes: Estimates are sourced from a non-representative survey of 84 US community foundations. Study conducted between late 2020 and early 2021.
